alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Lac Qui Parle; Pope; Stevens; Swift; Todd (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 11 at 9:12PM CST until January 16 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...WINTER STORM ARRIVES EARLY FRIDAY AND LINGERS INTO SATURDAY, THEN DANGEROUSLY COLD AIR FOLLOWS INTO NEXT WEEK... .Accumulating snow will make its way into southern and eastern Minnesota early Friday morning. This will be a long duration event, with relatively low snowfall rates around 0.5 inches/hour or less. Forecast confidence remains low thus large ranges remain in the snowfall forecasts. The best chances for 6 or more inches of snow is generally east of I-35 and south of the Twin Cities metro. Northwest winds will increase Friday afternoon in Saturday, gusting up to 40 mph in portions of southwestern MN. This will lead to blowing snow and the potential for brief white out conditions. Confidence is high that dangerously cold wind chills will follow into Saturday night, with widespread values of -25 to -40 likely through early next week. A Wind Chill Watch has been issued for much of western and southern Minnesota. ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central Minnesota. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
